title: self-xss with ClickJacking can leads to account takeover in Firefox

profile.name: Imgur
profile.about: The most awesome images on the Internet.

activities.message:
Hi @keer0k,
We have accepted the report as valid and added an issue in our internal issue tracker for your report. We will update this page when more progress is made.

Thanks!
The Imgur team really appreciates your report and would like to give you a monetary bounty. Thanks for taking the time to report this issue and please let us know if you come upon more issues!
When the fixe coming, we can do full disclosure of this report?
hi, it seems that isn't reproducible anymore, we can mark this as resolved?

Hi @keer0k,
Thanks for following up. Yes, this issue was fixed some time ago; apologies
for the delay. I will go ahead and mark this as **Resolved**.
hi @srinidhik i just realise that have another endpoint vulnerable to the same attack,can I comment here the PoC or it's needed a new report?

@keer0k,
Thanks for following up. Since you mention the endpoint is different
and this report has been marked as *Resolved* can you please open a
separate report?

Thanks.

hi @srinidhik , can you edit the report, exchange the

```
Para conseguir o account takeover usando esse XSS ainda é necessario abrir uma nova window com window.open("https://imgur.com/account/settings/password
","_blank") e depois implementar o seguinte código para conseguir ler os dados presentes nos inputs:
```

to 

```
To get the account takeover using this XSS it is still necessary to open a new window with window.open ("https://imgur.com/account/settings/password
"," _ blank ") and then implement the following code to be able to read the data present in the inputs:
```

and not show the messages that come after?

Hi @keer0k,
I don't think the report body can be edited; AFAIK, only titles are editable.

Thanks.
